answers.answer: High bp is a main sign of pre eclampsia. I have it. Having high bp means the doctor will normally induce early because it can be harmful to the baby. Im 36 weeks as well. We will talk about inducing once i make it to full term next week. Your doctor should recommend you be on bed rest if your bp is a problem. Moving around and doing stuff will increase your bp. The best thing to do to keep it down is to relax as much as possible. Stay in bed if you can and keep your feet up.

Hi there.  I had pregnancy hypertension or high blood pressure.  It never turned into preeclampsia.  In fact, I went 10 days past my due date.  It was not a problem for the baby or the birth.  However, after I gave birth---  my blood pressure did go higher.  I didn't even know but we stayed an extra day in the hospital for my blood pressure to go back to normal, which it did.  Having high blood pressure is not that uncommon.  They watch you, check your urine for protein, and ask you about other symptoms.  They also monitor your swelling.  I had some swelling in my feet, calves and face.   Not that bad though.  You begin seeing the doctor weekly and they'll keep your eye on you.  I did not go on bed rest but took it easier.  I sat with feet propped up.So, unless it continues to rise, I would not be overly concerned.One other thing, watch your salt!  good luck

I just want to clarify that many women have pregnancy hypertension or high blood pressure and do not get preeclampsia.  Again, I had high blood pressure and went 10 days past my due date.  It is only a significant issue if it DOES turn into preeclampsia which a good bit of the time, high blood pressure does not.  good luck

One last post.  Once it turns into preeclampsia, women are hospitalized and induced as soon as possible.  If you were anywhere near that point, your doctor would indicate this to you.  Again, many women just have high blood pressure.The worst thing about it is that it is a precursor for high blood pressure whe you age.  good luck

question: Is having high blood pressure bad? And how can i prevent it im 36 weeks
title: question
